content.body: Oh the dark-mode colors are inserted separately from the stylesheet itself. Look at any Bikeshed-generated spec, like the CSS specs, you'll find them.

Domenic: annevk : Hey, there was some agreement to remove <object usemap> from the spec, and I see the HTMLObjectElement doesn't have it anymore in the spec. However, it is still there in Gecko & Blink & WPT.
content.formatted_body: Domenic: annevk : Hey, there was some agreement to remove <object usemap> from the spec, and I see the HTMLObjectElement doesn't have it anymore in the spec. However, it is still there in Gecko & Blink & WPT.

content.body: ntim: Gecko has an open bug still
content.formatted_body: ntim: Gecko has an open bug still

content.body: Morning all, I have a silly question about `DocumentOrShadowRoot` mixin in https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#mixin-documentorshadowroot. If I have a shadow root, should I be able to use `getElementByTagName` since it's part of the mixin?
content.formatted_body: Morning all, I have a silly question about DocumentOrShadowRoot mixin in https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#mixin-documentorshadowroot. If I have a shadow root, should I be able to use getElementByTagName since it's part of the mixin?

content.body: AutomatedTester: I don't see it on the mixin?
content.formatted_body: AutomatedTester: I don't see it on the mixin?

content.body: AutomatedTester: in particular, note how the mixin doesn't define any members (HTML defines some)
content.formatted_body: AutomatedTester: in particular, note how the mixin doesn't define any members (HTML defines some)

content.body: ok, I thought (probably wrongly) that when I saw `DocumentOrShadowroot` that I could use the APIs interchangeable
content.formatted_body: ok, I thought (probably wrongly) that when I saw DocumentOrShadowroot that I could use the APIs interchangeable
